summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Howard regarding scheduling an interview for Howard's client, who has been served with a grand jury subpoena. The email includes an attachment of the subpoena and mentions a proffer agreement.

persons.name: Howard
persons.context: Addressee of the email; appears to be representing a client who has been served with a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email; works for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York; is coordinating an interview and proffer agreement for Howard's client.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with defense attorney to schedule an interview and provide legal documents regarding the attorney's client.
Howard is representing a client who has been served with a grand jury subpoena.
The prosecutor is seeking an interview and has served a grand jury subpoena on Howard's client.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was served on Howard's client, as indicated by the attached PDF filename.

events.title: Email Scheduling Interview
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Howard to schedule an interview for the following Monday afternoon at 2 p.m.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was served on an unnamed client represented by attorney Howard.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is actively investigating, as evidenced by the subpoena and planned interview.
The prosecution is seeking a proffer agreement from Howard's client, indicating potential cooperation negotiations.
The communication occurred on August 20, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, suggesting ongoing related investigations.
